# VTPixelRotationSession

**API Collection**

An object that rotates source pixel buffers to destination pixel buffers.

## Overview

To create a rotation session, call [doc://com.apple.videotoolbox/documentation/VideoToolbox/VTPixelRotationSessionCreate(_:_:)]. Optionally configure the session by calling [doc://com.apple.videotoolbox/documentation/VideoToolbox/VTSessionSetProperty(_:key:value:)].

To transfer pixels call [doc://com.apple.videotoolbox/documentation/VideoToolbox/VTPixelRotationSessionRotateImage(_:_:_:)].

When you’re done with the session, call [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFRelease] to tear it down and release your object reference.

## Managing a Session

- **VTPixelRotationSessionCreate(_:_:)**: Creates a session to rotate images between pixel buffers.
- **VTPixelRotationSessionInvalidate(_:)**: Tears down a pixel rotation session.

## Configuring a Session

- **Pixel Rotation Properties**: Properties used to configure a VideoToolbox pixel rotation session.

## Rotating an Image

- **VTPixelRotationSessionRotateImage(_:_:_:)**: Rotates a source pixel buffer and writes the output to the destination pixel buffer.

## Inspecting the Type Identifier

- **VTPixelRotationSessionGetTypeID()**: Returns the Core Foundation type identifier for the rotation session.

## Data Types

- **VTPixelRotationSession**: A reference to a pixel rotation session.

## Transformation

- **VTPixelTransferSession**: An object converts video data from source pixel buffers to destination pixel buffers.
